description: This is an honors version of Math 240 which explores the same topics but with greater mathematcal rigor.
name: LECTURE

values.comments:
This course is an honors version of Math 240 that explores the same topics but with greater mathematical rigor.

Students had mixed feelings about the course overall, though a few agreed that the course was “too theoretical” and “abstract.” A couple of students felt that “nothing was taught in context, and fundamental concepts were glossed over or skipped entirely.” One student mentioned that it was “difficult to understand some of what goes on in class, but if you put time into reading the textbook and talking to the TA, you can figure out what’s happening.”

Students generally liked Professor Grassi, as she was “very nice” and “enthusiastic about teaching.” However, they also felt that she was not always “very effective.”

The majority of students felt that this course was “extremely difficult” or “very intense.” One student said to expect spending at least 6-7 hours per week on this course. Another student recommended that people majoring in areas which require applied math (engineering, physics, etc.) should not take this course.
